Pre-Game Insights: India will take on Sri Lanka in a three-game ODI series after the Men in Blue whitewashed the hosts in the T20Is.
The R.Premadasa Stadium in Colombo will host all three games of the series which kicks off on August 2.
After winning the T20 World Cup, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will return to action for the very first time after their T20I retirements.
On the other hand, Charith Asalanka and the Lankans will look to avenge their T20I series loss and kick-start the ODIs on a winning note.
India will be the favourites to win the series with a stacked lineup full of world-beaters.
Sri Lanka will look for massive improvements after a disappointing performance in the T20I series.
Playing in their preferred ODIs, Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama and Charith Asalanka will look to end the side batting woes evident in the T20Is.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The R.Premadasa Stadium in Colombo has produced spin-friendly tracks where batters tend to struggle.
The average score of the venue is 256 in ODIs.
The batters have found it difficult to score runs due to the tracksâ€™ slow nature.
Whereas the bowlers, especially the spinners, have managed to use the surface to find some grip and turn to contain runs and take wickets.
